greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = least k>0 such that triangular(n) divides Fibonacci(k).
comment: Triangular(n)=n*(n+1)/2 is the n-th triangular number.
example: Triangular(2)=3, least k>0 such that 3 divides Fibonacci(k) is k=4, so a(2)=4.
xref: Cf. A085779 (least k such that triangular(n) divides k!).
Cf. A001177 (least k such that n divides Fibonacci(k)).
Cf. A132632 (least k such that n^2 divides Fibonacci(k)).
Cf. A132633 (least k such that n^3 divides Fibonacci(k)).
Cf. A215453 (least k such that n^n divides Fibonacci(k)).
Cf. A214528 (least k such that n! divides Fibonacci(k)).
results.author: _Alex Ratushnyak_, Aug 08 2012
